pageContext.description: Dimensions: L (bent) 66.8mm; max W. head 4.8; W shank swelling 3.2; B shank swelling 3.2; T head terminal 0.6; d across head 5.8; d. vert. 6.0,Typology: sub. sq. shank sec. - rounded corners and convex faces; becomes more crisp rect. sec. at lead into head which is v. thin and flat; end of roll (inside) has sq. notch in one corner - poss. orig.,Manufacture: head neatly rolled, inside loop scaled well against outer one,Condition: much of loop separate due to break across at eroded point - corr. associated dam.; bend at tip dam. or orig. - no conclusive evid.
pageContext.surface: Dull olive green patina; 2 or 3 long patches of flaking to pale green dry sur., also edges of head and scattered spots; smaller areas reduced further to dark brown surface including tip.
pageContext.toSearch: Highdown Hill, South Downs National Park, Ferring, Worthing, West Sussex Bn12 6pf, UK
pageContext.remarks: Labels/Markings: black ink: 3473,PIF; AFI; DF(C); SI; CI; SN Oct. 79; Source MV
